posts.post_content:
5 mana, for a 5/5 flyer is decent enough, especially when one of those colors is ![Green](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=G&type=symbol). Then you add the sac ability, and hexproof to it and this is one incredible legendary creature! I pulled this in my pre-release packs and based my deck around it. I never got to use it, but since my opponent was playing black the first round, would've been game changing had I been able to.
  
   
I may change my [thrun](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=thrun) around and make this the commander with hexproof stuff, or I may put it into [Uril](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Uril) for some enchantment beatdown.

I pulled this in my pre-release packs and based my deck around it. I never got to use it, but since my opponent was playing black the first round, would've been game changing had I been able to.

I may change my thrun around and make this the commander with hexproof stuff, or I may put it into Uril for some enchantment beatdown.

posts.post_content:
If anyone ever gets out Blossom, Bubbles, Buttercup, and Sorin-in-Drag out at the same time....o.O  
  
Yeah, that is probably a game you are going to win.  
  
Oh and Maelstrom Archangel and Kaalia of the Vast in the same deck make your idea completely feasible StoicChampion. Your general should probably be Scion of the Ur-Dragon, running all 5 Invasion Dragons, all 5 Kamigawa Dragons, and all 5 Planar Chaos Dragons, plus the Powerpuff Girls Angels.  
  
In fact, Maelstrom Archangel should be the only non-Legendary creature in your deck. :)  
  
EDIT: don't care if banned or not. must have Kokusho for the sake of Mega Cycle completeness! when you take him out they are just going to notice you are also running the Power Puffs with Kaalia and then they will still stop playing with you- might as well pull as much B.S. in Game 1 as possible before getting banned for life from your playgroup ;D

Posted By: CaptainBlue (5/19/2012 2:03:27 PM)
Rating:

@StoicChampion
It took some time to figure out how to dismantle your combination, but Phantasmal Image can do it. If I can't cast blue spells, then I will use black to get it into my graveyard and reanimate it. You can save yourself with ghostway, but I can deplete you of those by casting/reanimating a clone each turn.
You need a painter's servant too...and while you're at it, why not add a douse?
I think Magus of the Tabernacle gets around this too.

@igniteice
Note that not all of those work, because there is a rule of law in play, but a couple of those are super.

posts.post_content: *Gob-smackingly* powerful beatstick: Hyperefficient cost-to-size ratio, a body that's both evasive and untargetable by opponents, and a blanket immunity to edict effects not just for herself but for her whole board. I won't presume to know whether she'll turn out to be broken or just very, *very* strong, but Buttercup here pushes all sorts of boundaries. I suppose it's fitting, seeing as Sigarda was intended to be the Spiky member of the AR multicoloured angel trio (with [Gisela](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gisela) for Timmy and [Bruna](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bruna) for Johnny.)
posts.html:
Gob-smackingly powerful beatstick: Hyperefficient cost-to-size ratio, a body that's both evasive and untargetable by opponents, and a blanket immunity to edict effects not just for herself but for her whole board. I won't presume to know whether she'll turn out to be broken or just very, very strong, but Buttercup here pushes all sorts of boundaries. I suppose it's fitting, seeing as Sigarda was intended to be the Spiky member of the AR multicoloured angel trio (with Gisela for Timmy and Bruna for Johnny.)

Posted By: Cubozoan (7/7/2012 10:15:04 AM)

posts.post_content: I really hate this card. Guaranteed to be format-warping in the coming months. The amount of hexproof in Standard is already obnoxious (Dungrove Elder, Geist of Saint Traft, Thrun...), but to create a creature like Sigarda feels like a big slap in the face. With BSZ (and maybe Image and DoJ as well) rotating out, (reasonable) options for removing Sigarda are very few. With all the support she has in both green and white, expect her to show up in many decklists.
posts.html:

posts.post_content: This card is by far the best Legendary, if not THE best angel in Avacyn Restored simply due to the fact that she is the cheapest to cast out of all her sisters and is harder to remove than them, save Avacyn. In her colors, she can easily be cast turn four, and most players won't have an answer to a 5/5 hexproof flier that early in the game. 4.5/5 at least.
